website_summaries.verdict: An easy-to-use scale that will grow with your baby as he or she ages.
pros: Hold feature can estimate weight even when the baby is moving around
Large LED display that's easy to read
Converts to a traditional scale when your child is old enough to stand
cons: Not sensitive enough for weighing before and after feedings

customer_reviews.title: INACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. I bought this after I returned the medela scale that I rented from the hospital with hopes that I could continue to keep up with my Ex-preemie's weight gain in between doctors visit but after using the 20lb weight 6 times to check for accuracy the closes I got was 19 lbs 13oz. I will be returning this ASAP! :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great for weighted feedings
customer_reviews.text: Unless your baby is tiny and can lie perfectly still on command, this scale will not work for weighted feedings. My 2 m/o is 23" and 13.5 lbs. He's way too long for the tray and any arm flung over the side will throw off the weight. The "Hold" feature for taking average weights if the occupant is moving is not accurate enough when every ounce counts. I tried taking back-to-back readings this way and they were different by up to half a pound. Not going to work for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great for monitoring pet’s weight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scale to keep records of my cats’ weights. It works really well. It’s quite sensitive so the number can jump easily however, I find my cats don’t mind sitting on the tray and I can get a fairly accurate reading. Nice large numbers to read and battery powered. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate, useless
customer_reviews.text: This scale is not accurate and therefore useless for measuring milk intake. The weights are all over the place. We would do several weight checks in a row just to gauge the scale and they were all higher or lower by several ounces.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: I love the "HOLD" feature because the weight changes as they ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much SIMPLER life is with a scale that actually works with squirming puppies. I love the "HOLD" feature because the weight changes as they move around that that feature gives you a solid average. I'm telling all my breeder friends about this - a scale that is affordable and does a wonderful job!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra  Sterns

customer_reviews.title: Our kid loves it and so do we!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to weigh our baby because he was under weight and we wanted to monitor his progress he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cox

customer_reviews.title: To keep track of newborn's weight.
customer_reviews.text: Is sensitive enough to measure changes in a newborn's weight. Just need to keep them centered and fairly still. I wouldn't fully trust down to 1\2 ounce though. That being said to build confidence in the product I checked this against a bag of sugar, bag of flour, and 2 different size weights. All reading around half an ounce of target.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use scale and seems to be very accurate. I weighed two 3 pound weights and it read precisely at 6 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This scale is not accurate. We were using to measure baby’s weight growth, but this scale isn’t accurate compared to the doctor’s scale, so we’re disappointed after doctors appointment since the weight was much lower. I wish we could return, but it’s past the return window on Amazon. They should have more than 30 days for return window on something like this, that needs to be used for a while and validated by doctors scale.
customer_reviews.author: LES

customer_reviews.title: I love my scale
customer_reviews.text: I love my scale. I do cat rescue and these are what my whole rescue uses. I volunteer with one of the biggest cat rescues in Minnesota. We have several. I've had mine for a few years and I've never replaced the batteries. It's very accurate, very easy to clean, and very easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and sometimes doesn’t work at all
customer_reviews.text: Inspire of most recent negative reviews, unfortunately my husband and I still decided to go for this scale.. and it wasn’t a good decision. So many times it does not work and as we know babies can’t stay still for that long or at all.. and to make matters worse we accidently ordered 2 and in order to return I need to pay 10 dollars .. I thought it would be free returns since it was prime. Will not recommend this scale purely because of inaccuracy and so many times it just won’t show any number except 0.2 or 0.4 so some Random decimal number.
customer_reviews.author: Ameet Bakshi

customer_reviews.title: Great scale, very useful in the early weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this with 2 babies now. First one had a lip tie and wasn't gaining enough. I had to keep tabs on him while supplementing/building supply back. It was great. Second baby I started using it the day we came home to make sure he was gaining right (no ties with this baby) seeing how much he gains every week is reassuring and exiting! Highly recommend if you need it, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: Like another reviewer
customer_reviews.text: I received a broken one. Like another reviewer said, the weight would come out as approximately half my baby’s weight... was huge and a hassel to send back. At least we were within our return window.
customer_reviews.author: Tej

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but I would suggest going all out and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a nervous mom who had a baby with a weight issue. This scale at times gave me peace of mind;however, not always there have been a few occasions we’re our scale os Noticbly off. We tried to use it for about a month and it just made things worse. With leaps and growth spurts and our son needing to nurse more for comfort and growth spurt we need an accurate scale. Great concept but I would suggest going all out and spending the money on a better made product with a more consistent scale.
customer_reviews.author: JennyAnn

customer_reviews.title: Love this scale!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this scale. My favorite part is that you can weigh the clothes and diapers and etc that baby has on inorder to weigh them more accurately. I bought this because my baby's on the smaller side and the Dr said baby wasn't gaining weight properly. So I bought this scale and changed his feeding habits and keep track of his weight gain with this. So far he's improving and this scale keeps me worry free. My older toddlers love checking their weight with this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fbashar

customer_reviews.title: Great scale for peace of mind or curiosity!
customer_reviews.text: I got this just to check my little guys weight from time to time for my own curiosity. It’s pretty accurate, but it does fluctuate easily with movement so I don’t know that it would be accurate enough for medically necessary weighted feeds. But for a weight check for peace of mind or curiosity it’s a great scale. I’d recommend it. My little guy is 4.5 months old, 16 lbs 11 oz and 26.5” tall for size comparison. He fits on the scale fine with knees bent. It seems to be well made also. Not cheap feeling and it’s easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Broken / no support
customer_reviews.text: I’ve own this for a year now and hardly used it. There is no physical damage to the unit but the scale is broken. When it turns on I see 18.8888 across the screen. If I wait about 30 sec. the scale comes on but the scale is way off and cycles from .4 lbs to 84 lbs. It’s useless to me know. Calling their support I just get the run around and they never help me. The person I did speak to just transferred me back to the main phone tree. My suspicion is that there is no real support for this product. Just a number to call to appear to meet business standards.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Ok for older kids, not accurate enough for weighted feeds
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble but it wasn’t accurate enough for me to use for weighted feeds. I’m sure it’s fine if you don’t need an exact or very accurate weight, but when I was trying to determine if my newborn baby was getting enough breast milk, it was t accurate enough. Even when I used the hold feature, where it takes an average of weights to accommodate for a wriggling baby, I would get wildly different results, with a range of more than half a pound. I returned this.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works sometimes - other times it is useless. Called company and they told me to place ...
customer_reviews.text: No consistency in zero'ng out. Works sometimes - other times it is useless. Called company and they told me to place something (like a bag of sugar) on the scale a few times to help it calibrate properly. That works half the time - don't waste your money on this product. Well - I use this once a week - each week it gets worse - now, it just scrolls through the numbers! Bottom line - based on other positive comments - it is a crap shoot at best. I have purchased a lot of stuff and this is the worse item I have purchased to date!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Happy Happy!

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE I DID. This scale is not accurate and it does not work at all. Every time i position my son on it it tells me he is a different weight. Such a waste of money especially when you are tracking something as important as infant weight gain. So dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten Baker

customer_reviews.title: Tried everything, the scale simply does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Healtho-meter scale in February 2015 from Amazon, used it once to weigh my cat and put it away. Recently I took out (of the closet) again and wanted to see if the kitty increased or decreased in weight. The scale does not move. I've put a new battery in, it does not even weigh my exerceise weight of 5 pounds. The money is completely wasted. If I had bought it in a store, I could go to customer service. Now the money is completely wasted.. It does not even deserve this one star. If anyone has a suggestion, I'm ready to read it. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Must have for new moms.
customer_reviews.text: As a new breatfeeding mom this product has given me a lot of reassurance that my baby is getting enough to eat. I like the peace of mind to be able to check my baby’s weight in between our well checks. It’s accurate and very easy to use. We have no complaints with it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Machovina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect scale for us
customer_reviews.text: This scale works great. We had a baby that was 5lbs and 11 oz and I wanted a scale to weigh baby regularly and also gauge how much she was eating at feedings. This works very well for those needs.
customer_reviews.author: EPWEB

customer_reviews.title: Never worked! Very Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product ... Ever since day one when I unboxed it and tried to weigh my baby all i get is error messages and numbers going all crazy on the screen! It has NEVER worked and I have tried everything to get it to work! (new batteries, taking the plastic top part off and re-attaching it trying it on tables, floors, counters everywhere I try its the same issue)... I want my money back! or one that works! .. 0 stars if I could...should just go in the trash piece of junk! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie RoKu

customer_reviews.title: accurate! perfect reassurance between weight check doctor visits
customer_reviews.text: My baby was born small and there were concerns about her weight loss during the first week of life. She has gained more and what kept my mind at ease between doctor appts for weight checks was this scale. I weighed her before the appt with this scale and at the doctors office it matched! I felt confident knowing the scale is accurate to track her weight.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I'm having the same problem as others--the display doesn't work right. I bought it 3 years ago to weigh my small animals, and it was great. After about 1.5 to 2 years, the display lost a bunch of its segments. I changed the battery, and it work perfectly for a while. Now it doesn't work even with new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Hitchins

customer_reviews.title: Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: This scale works great. I use it to monitor my baby's weight as he had trouble gaining the first month. It has been very accurate for me as it matches the weight of the dr office when he has an appointment. I love that you can put a blanket on it so make it consider and zero out the weight of it. It also comes with a booklet that gives you lots of informations such as what/when teeth come in, what percentile your child's weight is and charts to record all of it. I would definitely reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Croft

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate readings
customer_reviews.text: I'll be returning this scale. I like the features and it's easy to use however when I put a 5 pound weight on it, it reads 5 lbs and 1.5 ounces. Add a 4 pound weight to that and it reads 11 pounds and some odd ounces meaning that the scale isn't just off in general but the variance keeps increasing with the more weight added to the scale. How am I supposed to know if it's ever remotely accurate?
customer_reviews.author: Bouscher99

customer_reviews.title: Ease your mind
customer_reviews.text: This scale helped ease my wife’s mind about how much our newborn was eating. After being told that: 1. Her supply was garbage 2. Our son dropped his jaw and couldn’t latch 3. She needed a shield to feed him 4. We needed to formula feed We found a doctor that understood the frustrations of trying to breastfeed. This scale allowed us to know he was getting the food he needed from breastfeeding as we could weigh him before and after a feed. Our son is now solely breastfeeding and has been growing much better now than he was!
customer_reviews.author: Joey H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my little guy who was having slow weight gain so that I could track his weight gain and do weighted feeds. Baby scales are pricey so after finding a great deal I decided on this one. After reading some other reviews that suggested that the scale may be off I decided to check for myself and our scale seems pretty accurate. So that was not an issue for us. I love that it can become a toddler scale too. Not only can I track my baby’s weight gain I can also get my toddlers weight when I need it easily enough. More bang for my buck!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: This scale does not work. It’s not accurate at all and a total waste of money. I have an infant who weighs approx 9 pounds, I attempted to weigh him this morning and even after I took him off of the scale the numbers continued to change and move before once again settling on a weight. The air in the house apparently weighs 20 pounds. I bought this before I needed it and regret that decision because I’m too far out to return it. Hoping this review can save someone else from making that mistake. Such a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to pediatricians scale.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scale to weigh my preemie baby at home. She had a little issue gaining weight at first so i Bought the scale to keep with her weight at home. If she wiggles the numbers kind of bounce back and forth but the scale was only 2oz off from the weigh in at the pediatricians office. I’m glad I bought it to give me piece of mind. The best thing is that it weighs in oz. a normal scale will only weight up .8 ozs but this will weigh up to .16oz. For example 4.14oz.
customer_reviews.author: Tbrady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and very well made. I got this to do weighed feeds with my newborn and have also used it to keep track of both his and my 2 year olds weight now that the toddler doesn’t have many dr appts. My son doesn’t hesitate to stand still because he says the scale looks like a bear and is happy to cooperate. You can use it set to lbs or kg...I usually weight before feed and after set on kg then I subtract the diff and convert that from kg to ounces. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for new moms
customer_reviews.text: A small price to pay for the comfort of knowing your baby is gaining on target. As a mom of babies who had trouble gaining in the beginning this was a life saver instead of fretting where baby was at weight checkups at the Drs officer I knew exactly what they weighed and it helped formulate a plan with much less stress
customer_reviews.author: marykay

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect scale for weighing my cats
customer_reviews.text: I use this scale to weigh my cats every week and he tray seems to be comfy because I always find them sitting in it. The scale is very consistent and also has a "hold" feature which will average out the weight reading when you have a wiggle worm on your hands. The weight is in pounds and ounces so a bit of conversion is needed to figure out the weight as a decimal, but that's easy enough (this seems to be the way people prefer for cats.) I bought this as an open box from the Amazon Warehouse and have been pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeysee

customer_reviews.title: Great scale for price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little scale for the price. We got it because when my daughter was first born we were having to take her into the doctor weekly to make sure she was gaining weight due to my milk coming in late. As a paranoid first time Mom it helped me feel more at ease to be able to weigh her at home too lol. Anyway the scale works great! And we can use it for lots of stuff now.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Paine

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but not sensitive enough to do "weighted feedings."
customer_reviews.text: The scale works great for making sure my little guy is gaining weight... it even has a "hold" feature that averages the readings when he won't hold still. Only downside is it's not sensitive enough to do "weighted feedings."
customer_reviews.author: Kate Vanderwoude

customer_reviews.title: Good for general weight, but not for infant feeding weight checks
customer_reviews.text: This scale seems fine if you are wanting a basic weight measurement for a baby. However, if you are relying on its accuracy to the stated degree in the description, this scale is not consistent. We tried using it to do before and after weights with our newborn to measure his milk intake, and even with using the hold feature, we would take 3 or 4 readings in a row and there would be a 60 gram (or 2 ounce) range in the readouts. For the purpose of measuring milk intake, this is not accurate enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Luv it!
customer_reviews.text: When we are not using it for baby, we are using it in the kitchen. (Bought this scale because we needed to make sure that our baby was gaining adequate weight after spending 3 weeks in the NICU.) lbs/Kg is awesome and the HOLD button makes all the difference when you are dealing with a ‘wiggley’ baby. Would totally recommend this for any new parent.
customer_reviews.author: Dean and Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have the right expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a good scale if you realize it won’t be as accurate or precise as the scale at the pediatrician’s office. We bought it to just see that our slow to gain baby as going up not for actual, precise measurements. It doesn’t handle a wiggling baby as well as a true baby scale. I’ve used it for nursing sessions just to make sure he is getting some milk but I never take the amount it says as true. It gives some peace of mind just know he got some amount of milk.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This scale is not accurate. We noticed couple of pounds variable difference using this scale and comparing that with a medical scale at different doctors office, on quite a few occasions. So we stopped using this scale to reduce confusion. In my experience using this scale for over 4 months, only once the weight came close enough with the doctors office scale, often weight at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Balaji

customer_reviews.title: Horribly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to monitor my infant as he wasn't gaining weight. But the weight varies so much, it's useless to see if he's gaining appropriately. It varies by 5 oz from 2 weights taken 1 minute apart from eachother. It's also impossible to get a hold weight as it jumps around so much with a wiggly baby. The tray itself is kind of small. My baby is a small 3 month old and he fills the tray. If I wasn't avoiding the post office, I'd return this product.
customer_reviews.author: VR

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic scale. Our baby ate a lot, but stayed skinny...and my wife always worried! Once we got this, she got a little crazy about weighing her everyday, but it gave her piece of mind...which is PRICELESS. Love this scale...high quality and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett DeLorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping track of overall growth
customer_reviews.text: Weight jumps around a lot since baby is always kicking but it’s always same or within a few ounces of doc office. We just want to see that overall she is gaining weight. This would not be a good scale if you’re trying to see how much baby eats during a nursing session since I can put her on it two times in a row and get weights that are a few ounces different. The infant tray is almost too small for my baby at 2mo/24”/14lb but still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Christiana T

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely  amazing buy
customer_reviews.text: Live this since the virus and cause my sons health I have to track his weight biweekly this does the job can put a blanket down and zero it out then weight baby
customer_reviews.author: jeanet bergbigler

customer_reviews.title: Not very precise, but is functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to monitor weight gain on my slow to gain newborn. I also wanted to do weighted feeds to see how much breastmilk she was able to transfer. The kg setting only measures to the second decimal place (ex. 2.42 kg) so, weighted feeds aren't as accurate as they could be. Simple to use and functional. Have not tried the scale in it's toddler function.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad to have this scale. It would have been nice to have when my son was born but he can still use it so I'm glad. I used a 1lb bag of pasta to check the accuracy and it was spot on. It's easy to use and no kids feel safer laying on it so they dont move around so much.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, accurate weights
customer_reviews.text: This scale is very solid, does not feel cheap at all. I weighed a gallon of water on it to test it and the weight was dead on. The plastic is matte and is warm and comfortable, we weigh the baby naked and he's never expressed discomfort. The weight pops up within seconds. Very easy to use, and appreciate the peace of mind being able to track baby's growth.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: easy way to weigh your baby at home
customer_reviews.text: i bought this scale to see how many ounces my baby takes in per feeding. it looks great, really sturdy, easy to set up. i found that the accurcy of the reading bounces around too much and can be inconsistent so if you want something very exact, this might not be a good fix. it would be great for a ballpark reading however
customer_reviews.author: Asclem512

customer_reviews.title: Baby scale
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item to weigh our preemie baby during the pandemic to avoid having the home health nurse come just to weigh the baby. It was very easy to assemble and set up. The surfaces are wipeable and we just put a chux pad on it when we weigh the baby There is a cool function where it takes the average weight as the baby is always moving
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction issue
customer_reviews.text: Seems like the scale has a malfunctioning. Sometime you can read the number, sometimes you can’t. We thought the battery was poor quality so we went and got new ones and it did the same, the reading, we have to turn it off and on multiple time until it’s readable.
customer_reviews.author: Jg

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this scale in March shortly after our first ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scale in March shortly after our first child was born. I expected to be able to use this to accurately measure his weight so we could save money on pediatrician appointments. Recently my wife has been using it more since we are concerned about his weight. Every time she weighs him the scale gives a different number. This is up to 6-8oz off at times. Now we will have to take him to the pediatrician's office and pay $100 just to get him weighed, or purchase a different scale. I know I'm past my return date, but I would appreciate it if the company could get back to me and offer some solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s just ok.
customer_reviews.text: It seems the accuracy is off by a couple of ounces. Not a huge deal, but it is a pain. Additionally it times out very fast and boot up is rather slow. The on button seems to stick a bit and doesn’t always register. Again, not a huge deal, but it can be when holding a baby!
customer_reviews.author: rebbaz royee

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for NICU baby
customer_reviews.text: I love this scale! It’s actually the 2nd time I’ve purchased this scale to make sure my babies are gaining weight while nursing. My youngest baby is 2 months old and had to stay at the NICU for 2 weeks, the second week because she was taking a while to gain weight. Now, she’s growing like crazy. I’m able to measure her whenever and it calms my nerves about her gaining what she should be. I haven’t had any issues with it either time. My only suggestion would be to warm it up a little before weighing baby because it can feel colder.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This scale is pretty accurate. I normally put a receiving blanket down on it before turning it on so it tares the weight of the blanket then put my baby on there. She doesn't mind it one bit unless I put her directly on the cold plastic. I also like how the sides are raised because she's really wiggly and it keeps her from rolling off. You can also take the little tray off for when they get older so a toddler can stand on it. We haven't gotten to that point yet but I'm sure it'll work just fine that way too. I also weighed some squash on it so there's a multi-purpose aspect that is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chelynn

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate to monitor baby weight gain
customer_reviews.text: The scale is very inaccurate for baby weight - it can show different figures just 2 minutes apart, even when a baby is not moving ... If you have some concerns about your baby weight gain and need to monitor the progress, do not go with this scale...
customer_reviews.author: Antoine Peiffer

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: This product is SPOT ON with doctor scales! I was nervous buying it, that it wouldn't be very accurate but it is. Theres months in between well baby appointments and people are always asking how much my little one weighs so I finally decided to buy a scale. Now whenever I'm curious I can whip it out and use it to know her weight. I'm very happy with my decision to purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scale
customer_reviews.text: My veterinarian has this scale, so I was pleased to find it for sale on Amazon. It does the job perfectly, even while weighing a squirming cat, is stable, sturdy and accurate. It would work well for babies and toddlers, too. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Smith

customer_reviews.title: GREAT METER AT GREAT PRICE BY GREAT MANUFACTURER!  GET IT!
customer_reviews.text: You cant go wrong with this product, What else do you want from a scale! It even has a pamphlet to track your baby's weight and gives you graphs for both males and females growth curves. All you have to do is put in a 9V battery and power on! Off you go! Yet to calibrate the accuracy but for what I need it for it doesnt really matter.. 1oz or more does it!?
customer_reviews.author: J. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Effectively Measure Weight
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product to use at home. The absolute slightest movement causes the weight on the scale to move up and down like crazy. My 3 month old was barely moving on it and the scale would not measure one exact weight. We had to stop it manually to get the numbers to stop climbing and falling. We tried it several times and it was never effective. Definitely not worth the money, will be returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna See

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Scale !
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and it is accurate - very close to what the baby weighed the same day at the doctor’s office. Just uses one 9 volt battery which is very easy to insert. I really like how it will grow with the baby, We have a baby who has feeding and intestinal issues so he will need to be weighed at least 1 time per week for the first year. Great price and FAST DELIVERY
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: It works but only accurate to the 1/2 oz.
customer_reviews.text: I love the scale. I use it to do weighted feeds for breastfeeding. As well as track my babys general growth. My only complaint is that its only accurate to the 1/2 oz. But i guess its close enough for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa or Kyrie

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product
customer_reviews.text: Funny thing is, someone really took an effort to pack this scale with torn enclosure. Outside box was not damaged, which makes me believe whoever packed it, do not care how their customer receive their products. Scale itself seems fine. This scale needs a 9V battery, which is not included. Just by seeing the package, I got turned off from even buying a battery and giving it a try. Its funny how a company can lost a customer by silly mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Love this scale
customer_reviews.text: Love this scale! Super easy to use. You can put a blanket on it and a diaper and zero it out before putting an almost naked baby on it! Great for breastfeeding mommas who want to make sure baby is getting enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this expecting to be able to use it for a weighted feed if you are breastfeeding, but it is still a great and very accurate scale. Great to use week to week to chart weight gain or just to humor your curiosity as baby grows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this for any first time breastfeeding mother
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this for any first time breastfeeding mother! Our first week, we had to go to the doctor three times for a weight check. It was so stressful and the baby and I were both working really hard on learning to breastfeed. By purchasing this scale, I could weigh her everyday at home to make sure we were consistently gaining weight. If we had a loss, I knew we needed to feed a little longer each time. This scale was only 1-2 ounces off from physician scale. Purchase this for ease of mind!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and a wonderful peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a wonderful peace of mind. My daughter struggled with weight gain after birth. After countless weight checks we were allowed to report her weight from home using this scale. My older daughter, 3, loves to step on and get her weight as it has both features.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Fagan

customer_reviews.title: Great for peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Really nice to know baby is gaining weight. also helps me figure out how much she’s eating (weigh before and after). Easy to use, best to zero with a blanket on it because it’s a hard surface.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: This is a great way to detect if your baby is on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Why would you not buy this? Having an accurate weight of your baby is important. Get an App to chart your baby's growth. The scale works very well, and is accurate. This is a great way to detect if your baby is on the growth curve or not, way before your pediatrician will know, as the usual appointments are too far apart.
customer_reviews.author: James Brittin

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate! Do not buy if you're looking for exact ounces!
customer_reviews.text: Not very accurate. Even with the scale zeroed out, my baby lying perfectly still, and using the "Hold" button, the scale gives me a different weight every time. And I'm not talking about a 1/2 ounce difference...I mean 4-5 ounces different. One minute it says he weighs 17 pounds; the next, he weighs 17 pounds, 4 ounces; a few minutes later, he weighs 16 pounds, 12 ounces. I bought this because my little one is underweight, and I want to be able to check his weight every few days to make sure he is gaining ounces, but this was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sperry Family

customer_reviews.title: trying to get an active 5 month old to lay still for a second is pretty difficult so we end up taking an average of ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait until I had an appointment for my son so I could see how accurate this scale was. It was actually only 1/2oz off of my doctor's scale. Yay! The only issue I had with this was that the baby has to be completely still for the scale to read a steady weight....trying to get an active 5 month old to lay still for a second is pretty difficult so we end up taking an average of what the numbers read while he wiggles. For us that works.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Scale Great for Checking my Small Animals' weights
customer_reviews.text: This Baby Scale is just what I needed to monitor my cats' weights. I have 2 sick ones, and now I can record their weight. I think it would work with any cat or small dog. Maybe even packages, since my older scale is "missing in action." Scales are just handy... Very pleased with this one. Needs a 9-volt battery.
customer_reviews.author: L.B.Redd

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate scale.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a scale that will give you an approximate weight for your baby (up or down several ounces again and again) then Buy it, if you are looking for accurate weight every time keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: This is a good scale for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good scale for the price. It is not very comfortable for the little ones, but it seems to be very accurate when I compared it with other scales. Does not take up very much space, which is why I like having it in my office. Not for heavy use, but for an occasional patient or weighing my own child at home I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: drkhenk

customer_reviews.title: Great way to monitor weight gain in baby
customer_reviews.text: Breastfed baby was gaining weight slowly and this scale provided us a way to keep track of weight and not have to bring in weekly for weight checks. The days we have weighed and taken to the doctor and have weighed the weights have been the same. Very reassuring.
customer_reviews.author: MamaRunner

customer_reviews.title: Handy to understand if your baby is gaining weight
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate enough to know whether your baby had enough milk, but generally accurate enough to determine trends on whether your baby is gaining weight. We've had this since her first few months - it is quick to use. The numbers do go up or down when the baby squirms, but I just take the median. It has been consistent with her weigh-ins at the pediatrician. I do like the feature so you can zero it out with a diaper or blanket so you don't have to put the naked baby directly on it. Have not used the standing feature for a toddler yet.
customer_reviews.author: Abby L

customer_reviews.title: Great for exotics
customer_reviews.text: Oh baby! Just what we needed. Those who have feathered friends know they have to watch weight of those exotics. Because they do not manifest a problem, you must use a diagnostic tool such as a scale. Dramatic weight loss is a panic button indicating there may be a problem. My friends love the scale and even bounce up and down to change the read out. Easy to use, easy to clean, accurate. This is not a cheesy scale, by any means. Some may find this amusing, but the loss of a fine feathered friend can be prevented or identified by the use of this scale.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I was super paranoid when I first started breastfeeding I wasn't sure if my little guy was gaining enough weight so I used these to ease my mind. It was pretty accurate it checked out with his dr at each visit which gave me piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Digital display stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine in the beginning. We had it for several years but only used it a handful of times (maybe 10 times). Now the digital numbers have crapped out so you can't see the weight on the display, making it useless. Glad it worked in the beginning but would expect it to last longer or at least with more usage.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool design
customer_reviews.text: Must have item for parents with small babies. Our son weighed 5lbs 15 ounces and got down to 5lbs 4oz. It was very important for us to track his weight weekly to ensure that he was gaining appropriately. Also, we were pleasantly surprised when we discovered that the top bucket comes off to become a children's standing scale. Pretty cool design!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a long time, not just for babies
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scale for 5 years now and we're still happy with it. Initially we used it just to weigh our children but it has since turned into our produce scale for canning. For the price, I would definitely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Seth W

customer_reviews.title: love it. I use this to weigh my 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: love it. I use this to weigh my 5 month son everyday and keep a growth chart of his gain, or loss of weight. My son was born with a serious heart condition so it is very important for me to keep a close eye on his weight to make sure he is getting enough food. Great scale.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C Grable

customer_reviews.title: Good for weighing cats and other small creatures.
customer_reviews.text: I got this scale to accurately weigh my cats at home when I needed to track one of them closely for a weight loss issue. Works great and I imagine it works well for babies too, haha.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use this for my cats
customer_reviews.text: The hold feature is awesome. It takes multiple measurements over a few seconds and averages them and keeps it on the screen long enough to get the reading.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Got this to weigh several aging pets when changing their diet to ensure they were getting plenty to eat to maintain health. A lot better option than taking them to the vet every couple of weeks just to check weight, with a lot less stress on everyone involved. Only knock is sometimes the kg/lb selector sticks and has to be pushed twice to get it to the lb option. If you're not careful, it'll be on the wrong one and you have to change it and weight again (or convert). HOLD option works well to get a good weight on a skittish pet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: This is one of my best purchases made for baby
customer_reviews.text: My newborn was in the 15th percentile for weight and declining so I was able to use this to weigh after each feeding. I can be a crazy woman weighing all the time without having to go into the docs office. This is one of my best purchases made for baby.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable but what scale ever is. We use it once a week to weigh our new born and are satisfied that it works. It is a little larger then expected but that’s not necessarily a bad thing. Do like that it converts to a child’s stand up/on scale for continued use after infancy.
customer_reviews.author: Owlbertoe

customer_reviews.title: It's fine for older kids
customer_reviews.text: It's very hard to get an accurate weight on this machine with a wiggling baby. It fluctuates by several ounces even with minimal baby movement. It's fine for older kids, but when ounces matter when doing weighted feeds for newborn, or accurate weight checks when having feeding issues this is not the best scale.
customer_reviews.author: V. Schisler

customer_reviews.title: Great For Pet Owners
customer_reviews.text: This is an invaluable tool for a cat owner. I don't have to crate my cats and take them to the vet to monitor their weight anymore. Less stress on them, less stress on me! This scale is the perfect size. It was a great purchase, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great for Babies and Cats!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat. My cat is underweight and sick. My vet wants me to weigh him weekly so I purchased this scale. It shows the exact weight that my vets scale showed.
customer_reviews.author: AmyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Baby Scale
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in order to keep track of my cat's weight, as she has been ill. It is very easy to use, uses nice, big clear numbers too read on the readout, and can be set to minus the weight of the carrier that I must put her in as I weigh her. After my use of it is done, I will pass it along to my niece, who has an infant. It was very hard to find a reasonably priced baby scale, and this does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bookie

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: Easy and convenient! I like the piece of mind it offers. At first I was reluctant because I thought it would drive me crazy constantly checking my baby's weight, but not at all. I occasionally check throughout the week and I love knowing instead of waiting to get to his next apt. I also downloaded an app that keeps track of weight. It gives percentages and host of other great to know info.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this scale
customer_reviews.text: Love this scale! My twins were born early, so weighing them was a must every other day. This was soo much better than going into the doctors office. The scale is fairly accurate. We have not moved the scale like others have suggested, so it has not need to readjust to different settings. Permanent place is the best thing for accuracy. We will soon be converting it into a regular scale!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Luchi

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Bought to monitor baby's weight and aligned with scale at doctor's office. If breastfeeding or worried about baby's weight/gains, its great to have for assurance and to keep track.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: works Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this scale to anyone having a litter of pups or kittens needing weight Perfect, it was right on with my vet. Love Love this scale!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Different readings but seems to be fairly accurate overall
customer_reviews.text: This scale is easy to use for baby and young kids. However, I noticed that it will read differently depending on end the head of the baby is resting.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for Breeders! (Human and Animal!)
customer_reviews.text: This baby scale has gotten us through two kids and also been used to weigh small baby farm animals. I have checked it with my doctor's office to make sure the weight readings are accurate, and this scale is always right on the dot! You can remove the top baby-holder portion for your toddler to stand on it to get a more accurate weight than your bathroom scale, too. Highly recommend to not only parents, but breeders of dogs, goats, sheep, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie T.

customer_reviews.title: The curved tray is perfect for babies
customer_reviews.text: We are approaching 5 years with this scale and it's still going strong! We used it with our firstborn when we were the typical first-time parents, worried about our baby's weight gain. And we've been using it now too, with our second child. No complaints at all. The curved tray is perfect for babies. The "security lock" is a really sensible and easy to use feature. I hIghly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: SugarPlum

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to weigh my guy at home and keep track of his growth! Thanks for making an affordable, accurate, at home scale that we can continue to use as he gets older!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Plotts

customer_reviews.title: A must for breastfed babies.
customer_reviews.text: It gives me such peace of mind to weigh my daughter whenever I please to know she is gaining weight appropriately since she is exclusively breastfed. Easy to use, love the zero out feature so I can lay a blanket down to keep her more comfortable so she won't squirm as much so I can get an accurate weight. We love this scale!
customer_reviews.author: MMJ2009

product_meta.title: Health o Meter Grow with Me 2 in 1 Baby to Toddler Scale with Growth Chart Book
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteThe Health o meter 2 in 1 baby and toddler scale converts from infant tray style to traditional foot platform to adjust to your child’s growth. The scale is shaped in the face of a teddy bear, making it friendly for children of all ages. Includes the Healthy Growth Baby Book contains growth charts to help you monitor and track your child’s weight and height compared to national averages.

AMAZON.COM
The Health-o-Meter HDC100-01 "Grow with Me" Teddy Bear Scale is a first-of-its kind consumer baby and toddler scale. As your child grows, the scale easily converts from a tray to a platform, making this a versatile and cost-effective device for weighing your child as he develops from a newborn to a toddler. 


Use the Teddy Bear Scale to weigh your baby or toddler. View larger. 
Remove the tray to weigh your child in a standing position. View larger. 
Large 1.2-inch LCD display. View larger. The large, easy-to-read 1.2-inch LCD display is front-facing so reading the weight is a breeze. Also, for added accuracy with small children, the scale weighs in half-pound increments up to 60 pounds. Calibration is a snap with a "zero out" feature that allows you to adjust for the weight of clothing or a diaper. This scale is powered by a replaceable nine-volt battery (not included), includes a growth chart to track height and weight against national averages, and it is backed by a five-year limited warranty. Operating the Scale
Place the scale on flat, level surface. A hard surface, such as a tile or linoleum floor, is the best for maximum accuracy. If the scale is placed on a soft, deep rug, then it may not produce accurate results. Once the scale is placed on an appropriate surface, press On/Off and wait for the display to show zeros. If the display shows "0:0", the scale is set to pounds/ounces; if the display shows "0.00" the scale is set to kilograms/grams. Press the lb/kg button to select between pounds or kilograms.

 The scale can be operated with or without the tray. When using the tray, make sure that it is securely locked into place before placing your baby on the scale. Simply lay your baby on the tray and read the display. To use the scale without the tray, you'll need to remove the tray by turning the locking nut clockwise. The tray is replaced by four rubber plugs and a supplied plastic cover tab. Once the cover is in place, hold your baby upright on the scale, and place the baby's feet so that the weight is evenly distributed. Of course, everyone knows that a baby rarely holds still. Health o Meter has an answer. If your child is moving, press the "Hold" button to lock in the correct weight. This function displays the baby's average weight for the time period. 

 
What's in the Box
HDC100-01 baby and toddler scale, growth chart, and warranty.
feature_bullets: Health o meter's baby scale precisely measures the weight of your newborn within 0.5 ounces (or 0.1 kilograms); This accurate measurement lets you monitor your child’s growth in between doctor visits

The infant tray comes equipped with a security lock for added stability during use, while the HOLD feature captures the precise weight measurement of an active baby; once your baby outgrows the tray, the scale converts to a toddler scale with a capacity of Upto 60 pounds
The scale’s large LCD digital display makes it easy to read
Includes a healthy growth baby book for tracking the weight and height of your child, height and weight national averages from birth to 36 months, plus a tooth tracker and toddler shoe size chart
10 year limited warranty; Requires a 9 volt battery (not included), works well and long with Polaroid 9V batteries
